text: Computer science hero Alan Turing died. His death was ruled a suicide from eating an apple containing cyanide. Turing formulated the famous Turing test and broke code at Bletchley park during World War II.
Sony introduced the Betamax video recorder for sale. It would lose the format war to VHS but find a niche in broadcast production.
The first U.S. solar power plant was dedicated at the Natural Bridge National Monument, Utah.
